reuters.unknown: V f reute u f AM BRITAIN STLD

text.title: THATCHER FIRM AS PRESSURE MOUNTS FOR ELECTIONS
text.author: By Colin McIntyre Reuters
text.body: As pressure mounted on British Prime Minister Margaret Thatcher to call June election she today decision on when to go to county hers hers alone She speaking to parliament after senior members ruling Conservative Party urged her to call elections due June year early wake two more opinion polls giving her party commanding lead Asked by Conservative back bencher assurance decision hers alone did depend on media hype pressure speculation she replied The date next election be decided by Downing Street Fleet Street Downing Street Prime Minister s official residence Fleet Street traditional home British national press Harris poll breakfast time program TV AM gave Tories pct vote representing majority seats parliament their biggest lead since party s landslide victory elections Times London MORI poll gave Tories seat majority sixth poll to show ruling party big lead over opposition Labour Party fast improving centrist Alliance Leading chorus urging Thatcher to go to polls June Sir Marcus Fox vice chairman influential committee Conservative back benchers I always felt be June reinforces my view I always thought June right We got most our legislation through to go beyond I do think be national interest Another Tory back bencher Anthony Beaumont Dark I always been October man but I think be good to get out way now Their comments came as government officials dismissed speculation snap election to coincide local polls May timed to reap maximum advantage recent popularity surge Thatcher s successful trip to Moscow Labour s current popularity slump Calls May poll were also prompted by Tory concern over steady advance by Alliance possibility if continues could rob Conservatives overall majority parliament Today s MORI poll showed Alliance gain eight points over past month around key marginal seats where outcome next election likely to be decided

text.body: Up to pct finance companies operating Sweden likely to be squeezed out over next few years by deregulation financial markets Association Swedish Finance Companies Association chairman Arne Ogren told news conference major restructuring sector inevitable Central Bank governor Bengt Dennis when announcing deregulation November one his main aims to give commercial banks chance to compete on equal terms finance companies so undermine Sweden s grey market Total credit granted by Swedish finance companies rose to billion crowns billion includes leasing equivalent pct all outstanding loans by banking sector at end Ogren if proposals now being discussed by government appointed inquiry into credit market to license finance companies make them increase their share capital were pushed through up to pct disappear But he fact little effect on credit volumes as biggest finance companies accounted pct lending by entire sector explosive growth Swedish finance companies began early s commercial banks even started their own to get around tight restrictions then imposed on banking activities particularly on growth lending Now they were on equal footing their parent companies many bank owned finance companies faced identity crisis Ogren He predicted there be mergers individual firms carve out specialised niches to ensure their survival deregulated climate Ogren sector s losses on bad loans were bound to rise steeply due to rush to increase credit

reuters.unknown: F f reute u f BC JAPAN CUTS CHIP SUPPL

text.title: JAPAN CUTS CHIP SUPPLY MAY PRODUCE SHORTAGE
text.author: By Sam Fromartz Reuters
text.body: Japan attempting to cut back semiconductor production to forstall dlrs U S tariffs on Japanese electronic goods set to take effect April industry analysts move likely to create sharp price rise possible shortage key computer components next few weeks analysts Prices gone up memory components mainstay Japanese semiconductor industry analyst Drew Peck Donaldson Lufkin Jenrette But analysts price rises been slight so far some questioned whether Japan be successful forcing Japanese companies to cut production long run Others however were more optimistic saying evidence already hand Japan cut back prodution halted sales to grey market third country brokers sell chips at below production costs We ve seen grey market begin to dry up D RAMS virtually dried up EPROMS Merrill Lynch analyst Thomas Kurlack two key memory chips used computers Prices inching up lead times on deliveries stretching Kurlack added Industry analysts Japan s Ministry International Trade Industry or MITI requested cut backs production to meet terms year s semiconductor accord U S Reagan adminsitration recently proposed tariffs on Japanese electronic goods alleging Japan failed to live up to accord continued to dump computer components U S market But some analysts Japan s attempt to mollify U S double edged sword might be read at subtle form trade retaliation tariffs proposed by U S As production Japan cut these analysts argue prices rise U S few American semiconductor manufactures be able to take up slack since most long ago exited market memory chips U S computer makers use chips their machines then be pressured The Japanese looking ways to reduce trade pressures Washington but at same time they re demonstating their muscle analyst Peck cut backs Japanese production expected to benefit U S chip makers I think could be very important factor U S semiconductor manufacturers industry analyst Elliot Levine Ladenburg Thalmann Co But analyst Peck it take few weeks to see whether Japan genuinely cut production He Japanese manufactures were likely to view MITI s request unfavorably because chip capacity still high production cut backs lead to significant write offs plant equipment

text.title: KUWAIT ASKS TO USE FOREIGN FLAG TANKERS U S SAYS
text.body: Kuwait asked at least four countries including United States Soviet Union Britain China temporary use their flags or tankers to protect Kuwaiti oil shipments troubled Persian Gulf Reagan Administration officials officials confirmed New York Times report Kuwait wants to transfer some oil tankers to U S or Soviet registration hopes Iran be reluctant to launch new Silkworm missiles at superpower flags United States vowed to keep gulf open to international oil traffic warned Tehran against using Chinese made missiles recently installed Iran near mouth gulf They the Kuwaitis also asked Britain China possibly some other European countries to lease tankers to carry their oil one administration officials who asked to be identified told Reuters United States considering request to temporarily transfer Kuwaiti ships to American registration but such move could create insurance other problems officials U S defense officials told Reuters yesterday Kuwait decided at least time being to accept U S offer to use American warships to escort tankers gulf where both Iran Iraq been attacking shipping

reuters.unknown: C G f reute r f BC U S GRAIN CERTS SAVE

text.title: U S GRAIN CERTS SAVE MLN DLRS AMSTUTZ
text.body: The use generic commodity certificates or certs fiscal years save government to dlrs Department Agriculture Undersecretary Daniel Amstutz Speaking at House agriculture subcommittee hearing on use certificates Amstutz issuance billion dlrs certificates during fiscal years could result government outlays up to dlrs However use certificates preclude need to dlrs storage handling costs resulting net savings government dlrs he Without use certificates Amstutz nearly entire crop been put under loan been forfeited to Commodity Credit Corporation CCC addition bushels grain been redeemed CCC inventory through certificate exchanges remained goverment inventory he When asked to comment on recent study by General Accounting Office concluded certificates result net cost to government Amstutz GAO underestimated benefits overstated costs certificate program Amstutz while certificates encourage more loan entries they also encourage heavier loan redemptions rather than forfeitures GAO underestimated net loan activity Amstutz There no question mind Department Agriculture these certificates been very useful Amstutz Immediate benefits certificates include greater market liquidity improved market price competitiveness higher farm income improved debt situation decreased carrying costs he Certificates integral part USDA s long range market oriented farm policy he Amstutz told subcommittee Chairman Rep Dan Glickman D Kans USDA process preparing official response to GAO study on certificates submit to subcommittee when completed

text.title: U S URGES SURPLUS NATIONS TO BOOST GROWTH
text.body: Leading industrial nations be reviewing Paris agreement to stabilize exchange rates foster increased worldwide growth reduce trade imbalances but U S thinks accord been successful so far senior U S Treasury official The Paris accord be reviewed at meeting been successful continues to be succesfull senior U S Treasury official told reporters briefing ahead week s semiannual IMF World Bank meetings he also U S looking to West Germany Japan to bolster their economic growth official both surplus countries like West Germany Japan deficit countries like U S agreed to play role bringing more balanced economic growth He reaffirmed U S press ahead efforts to reduce budget deficit resist protectionism boost U S competitiveness official also he expected trade issues like dispute between U S Japan over microchips to be included discussions official made no direct comment on content or schedule forthcoming Group Five Group Seven discussions He industrial countries concerned large external imbalances remain threat to international monetary system He added meetings also provide opportunity to discuss economic policy coordination efforts official indicators be used to measure policy objectives industrial countries their economic projections They also be used to assess progress policy goals Asked whether U S proposing new initiative regarding indicators official issue be reported to Venice Summit June Monetary sources U S proposal envisages using indicators to make policy coordination agreements like Paris Accord more binding

reuters.unknown: F f reute h f BC U S IMMIGRATION RULE

text.title: U S IMMIGRATION RULES SPARK CONGRESS OBJECTIONS
text.body: New immigration rules relating to alien farm workers reportedly being drafted by U S Agriculture Department meeting objections Congress sources on Capitol Hill USDA drafting regulations required by law offer amnesty to illegal aliens if they worked cultivation fruits vegetables other perishable commodities department considering including definition perishable commodities such farm products as tobacco hops Spanish reeds Christmas trees while excluding sugar cane New York Times reported yesterday Rep Howard Berman D Calif like to see definition extended to include sugar cane cultivation a breeding ground one scandals nation Gene Smith spokesman Berman Livestock dairy poultry producers been lobbying USDA hard to their products covered by amnesty provision farm industry sources Chuck Fields American Farm Bureau Federation livestock producers were desperate because they fear they be unable to retain many illegal aliens who joined industry House staff member involved drafting landmark immigration law who asked to be identified Congress did mean to extend special amnesty provisions to workers who helped cultivate tobacco inclusion hops Spanish reeds marginal addition lawmakers made clear during consideration bill lumber workers were to be covered by amnesty provisions making inclusion Christmas trees a tough call source USDA officials declined to comment on draft regulation except to say subject to change before be released probably some time later month While lawmakers may object to USDA rule under consideration relating to perishable commodities Congress likely to reopen debate on controversial immigration question congressional sources amnesty provision specially designed farm workers crucial to passage overall immigration bill Congressional staff members estimate special farm worker amnesty provision apply to between to aliens law allow eligible farm workers who worked days during year ending May to apply temporary then permanent resident status

reuters.unknown: V f reute b f BC YEUTTER WARNS CONGRES

text.title: YEUTTER WARNS CONGRESS ON TRADE RETALIATION
text.body: U S trade representative Clayton Yeutter if Congress were to require trade retaliation only close markets result less trade remarks prepared address to members University Chicago s Graduate School Business Yeutter many Congressional proposals do appear to be overtly protectionist yet their undeniable effect be to close off market opportunitites just as exchange rate movement unleashing such opportunities first time several years Despite all our progress on trade policy despite President s comprehensive competitiveness initiative there many Congress who still supporting trade bills containing many dangerous provisions Yuetter Yeutter many countries prefer U S retaliation to opening their own markets We should be intelligent enough to let them off hook easily he He tough but flexible legislative language infinitely preferable to tough but inflexible language Both House Senate trade proposals place undesirable limits on Presidential discretion he Limiting President s ability to consider all available options on issues as sensitive as these be most unwise Yeutter That could readily provoke retaliation unneccesarily embroil us trade wars injuring most competitive export industries Yeutter present U S trade laws fundamentally sound President Reagan threatened or implemented retaliation eight times months most recently case Japanese semiconductors being dumped world markets He took these steps as resort only after carefully analyzing all contingencies on case by case basis only after determining such actions open markets to American exports he Yeutter be foolish to attempt to solve U S trade deficit by focusing on trade policy alone He added trade deficit created primarily by macroeconomic policy shortcomings here abroad

reuters.unknown: RM V f reute b f AM DEBT COMMISSION

text.title: BRAZIL SETS UP SPECIAL DEBT COMMISSION
text.author: By Rene Villegas Reuters
text.body: Brazil set up special debt commission headed by Finance Minister Dilson Funaro to be responsible renegotiating Brazil s billion dollar foreign debt officials principal negotiator on commission created by President Jose Sarney be former foreign minister Ramiro Saraiva Guerreiro Officials Guerreiro be joined on commission by eight senior officials including representative National Security Council creation commission intended to underscore Brazilian government s contention debt issue essentially political political solution must be found to problem On February Brazil suspended interest payments on billion dollar foreign bank debt to try to force issue Creditor banks however signalled they equally determined to resist Brazil s demands debt relief Yesterday Funaro travelled to United States fresh debt negotiations creditors deeply angered by Brasilia s suspension interest payments Funaro due to hold talks New York today private sector before travelling to Washington semi annual meeting International Monetary Fund World Bank Officials new commission start work earnest when Funaro returns United States Yesterday Funaro called new forum discussion foreign debt He suggested direct participation governments creditor countries debt talks negotiations on commercial debt talks traditionally been restricted to banks creation new commission brings Brazil s highly professional Foreign Ministry much more into forefront on debt issue than been past During period military rule ended Foreign Ministry played very minor role debt policy But new commission diplomats among members chief negotiator Saraiva Guerreiro seasoned envoy long diplomatic career

reuters.unknown: RM V f reute u f BC ECONOMIC SPOTLIGHT

text.title: BRAZIL S DEBT CRISIS BECOMING POLITICAL CRISIS
text.author: By Stephen Powell Reuters
text.body: Brazil s financial crisis rapidly becoming political social crisis President Jose Sarney faces increasingly serious questions his future As Brazil enters debt talks creditors United States week political analysts say Sarney s administration never appeared weaker full political price Sarney to pay failure much vaunted anti inflation Cruzado Plan still clear He might to pay presidency Calls increasing direct presidential elections to pick successor to Sarney early next year length his term be decided by Constituent Assembly Sarney been lobbying six year term Sarney came to power without facing presidential elections March when military bowed out after years rule Although there wide public support direct elections president military as one their acts insisted electoral college where felt more influence make choice college chose Tancredo Neves popular politician who headed Brazilian Democratic Movement Party PMDB opposed military rule part to smooth relations military Neves chose Sarney supporter generals purely ceremonial post vice president But Neves died before he could take office Sarney took power He won grudging support PMDB Cruzado Plan wildly popular inflation weary Brazilians But Cruzado Plan failed politics Brazil been same The country rudderless ship U S Diplomat echoing common view government lacks any clear idea how to tackle economic crisis Sarney appeared increasingly isolated criticism coming business community trade unions some military media political opponents Many businessmen unhappy Sarney s decision announced on February to suspend interest payments on billion dlrs foreign debt motor industry executive The business community thinks Brazil should go to IMF Their rules sometimes harsh strict but only way to put house order Trade unions generally support debt moratorium but disagree other aspects government policy Since end February they organized national strikes seamen bankworkers federal university teachers countless local stoppages protests Economic problems prompted criticism some military figures including army ruler General Joao Figueiredo sign times almost daily military men deny there going to be coup If army does stay barracks key arbitors Sarney s fate be PMDB s leaders So far they taken clear stand on issue direct elections But one PMDB leader Senator Affonso Camargo pointedly yesterday sovereign right Consituent Assembly to call direct elections presidency whenever wished media Sarney to contend strong criticism One senior political commentator Fernando Pedreira Jornal do Brasil wrote newspaper week President Sarney man good intentions but just possible he himself aware true state country people since immense failure Cruzado Plan The disappointment frustration irritation enticement been and continue to be too great too profound He called direct elections early as only way out present crisis One Sao Paulo s leading news magazines Senhor editorial week The anarcho populist government President Jose Sarney failed Two years already been too long such disastrous experience It deserves to be buried as quickly as possible natural solution direct elections soon government s inability to control inflation now bringing serious social problems explosion rents Sao Paulo thrown tens thousands families onto streets because they can no longer afford to pay even wooden shack slums local press says city experiencing biggest wave land invasions history According to rental agencies rents increased pct little more than year Even cheapest shacks now cost cruzados dollars month half as much again as minimum wage all many earn Cardinal Paulo Evaristo Arns Roman Catholic archbishop Sao Paulo warned yesterday possibility a social conflict unimaginable proportions his back to wall politically social tensions rising Sarney no position to compromise on debt

text.body: Brazil set up special debt commission headed by Finance Minister Dilson Funaro to be responsible renegotiating Brazil s billion dollar foreign debt officials principal negotiator on commission created by President Jose Sarney be former foreign minister Ramiro Saraiva Guerreiro Officials Guerreiro be joined on commission by eight senior officials including representative National Security Council creation commission intended to underscore Brazilian government s contention debt issue essentially political political solution must be found to problem On February Brazil suspended interest payments on billion dlr foreign bank debt to try to force issue Creditor banks however signalled they equally determined to resist Brazil s demands debt relief Yesterday Funaro travelled to U S fresh debt negotiations creditors deeply angered by Brasilia s suspension interest payments

reuters.unknown: RM A f reute b f BC DOLLAR ENDS WITH MOD

text.title: DOLLAR ENDS WITH MODEST LOSSES IN NEW YORK
text.body: The dollar ended modest net losses against most major currencies as market conducted final round position squaring ahead tomorrow s crucial Group Five Group Seven meetings dealers The dollar trendless today People waiting to see if anything new comes meetings tomorrow then take there one dealer at top European bank As result generally supportive comments by Federal Reserve Chairman Paul Volcker Japanese Finance Minister Kiichi Miyazawa went largely unheeded dollar closed at yen down However dollar s yen closing level comfortably above overseas low just under yen Against mark dollar finished at marks after falling to Europe ending at here yesterday Congressional testimony morning Fed Chairman Paul Volcker harped on his long held fears potentially catastrophic fallout sharp dollar decline He also dollar s fall thus far should be large enough context growing world economy fiscal restraint U S to support widespread expectations narrowing real trade deficit period ahead market impact Volcker s comments minimal It same old story Volcker just fulfilling his role as defender currency one trader market similarly dismissive Japanese Finance Minister Kiichi Miyazawa s upbeat appraisal his hour long conversation U S Treasury Secretary James Baker afternoon Miyazawa they both agreed on need currency stabilization he satisfied role U S played coordinated international efforts to prop up dollar since late February Paris agreement Miyazawa can talk until he s blue face only person who make difference Baker Alan Rose First Interstate Bank Los Angeles The key question currency market whether Reagan administration change view on dollar If dollar going lower he added dollar s recent tumble to year low yen linked to market s perception Washington unhappy rate adjustment world trade imbalances continued orderly dollar decline least disruptive way accelerating process While most analysts do expect any marked change attitude Washington they were reluctant to open any fresh positions until later week We reserving judgement time being Doug Madison Commerzbank Ag tranquility dollar market spread to sterling trading today pound ended unchanged against dollar at edged up to marks yesterday However underyling sentiment remains positive after U K opinion poll gave ruling Conservative party highest popularity rating since re elected Sterling still seems to be on firm side one dealer Canadian currency also retained generally stronger tone rising to to U S counterpart yesterday According to figures provided by Morgan Guaranty Trust Co dollar s trade weighted value at midday pct below average market rates compared pct yesterday

text.title: DOLLAR ENDS WITH MODEST LOSSES IN NEW YORK
text.body: The dollar ended modest net losses against most major currencies as market conducted final round position squaring ahead tomorrow s crucial Group Five Group Seven meetings dealers The dollar trendless today People waiting to see if anything new comes meetings tomorrow then take there one dealer at top European bank As result generally supportive comments by Federal Reserve Chairman Paul Volcker Japanese Finance Minister Kiichi Miyazawa went largely unheeded dollar closed at yen down However dollar s yen closing level comfortably above overseas low just under yen Against mark dollar finished at marks after falling to Europe ending at here yesterday Congressional testimony morning Fed Chairman Paul Volcker harped on his long held fears potentially catastrophic fallout sharp dollar decline He also dollar s fall thus far should be large enough context growing world economy fiscal restraint U S to support widespread expectations narrowing real trade deficit period ahead market impact Volcker s comments minimal It same old story Volcker just fulfilling his role as defender currency one trader market similarly dismissive Japanese Finance Minister Kiichi Miyazawa s upbeat appraisal his hour long conversation U S Treasury Secretary James Baker afternoon Miyazawa they both agreed on need currency stabilization he satisfied role U S played coordinated international efforts to prop up dollar since late February Paris agreement Miyazawa can talk until he s blue face only person who make difference Baker Alan Rose First Interstate Bank Los Angeles The key question currency market whether Reagan administration change view to dollar If dollar going lower he added dollar s recent tumble to year low yen linked to market s perception Washington unhappy rate adjustment world trade imbalances continued orderly dollar decline least disruptive way accelerating process While most analysts do expect any marked change attitude Washington they were reluctant to open any fresh positions until later week We reserving judgement time being Doug Madison Commerzbank Ag tranquility dollar market spread to sterling trading today pound ended unchanged against dollar at edged up to marks yesterday However underlying sentiment remains positive after U K opinion poll gave ruling Conservative party highest popularity rating since re elected Sterling still seems to be on firm side one dealer Canadian currency also retained generally stronger tone rising to to U S counterpart yesterday According to figures provided by Morgan Guaranty Trust Co dollar s trade weighted value at midday pct below average market rates compared pct yesterday

text.body: Stocks fell steeply level avalanche selling unleashed by jump credit market interest rates renewed fears dollar could fall further After first extending rally hit all time closing high Monday Dow Jones industrial average skidded points to fifth largest point drop on record WASHINGTON Japanese Finance Minister Kiichi Miyazawa he U S Treasury Secretary James Baker were agreement on need stable foreign exchange rates Speaking after hour long meeting Baker Miyazawa also he satisfied U S intervention to support dollar against yen He expected Group Seven countries due to meet tomorrow to reaffirm so called Louvre accord to stabilize foreign exchange rates NEW YORK dollar bounced higher near close trading as stock bond markets went into steep slide but most traders awaiting results top level meetings Washington before committing themselves NEW YORK Texaco Inc asked Texas Court Appeals to block enforcement billion dlr judgment bond won by Pennzoil Co until appeals decided Texaco Monday if to pay full bond be forced to seek protection under Chapter Bankruptcy code NEW YORK AFG Industries Inc Wagner Brown ended their hostile bid to acquire GenCorp Inc after company s dramatic announcement Monday sweeping anti takeover measures GenCorp large diversified manufacturing concern announced billion dlr or dlr share buyback percent stock sale tire soft drink bottling units NEW YORK firm comprised E F Hutton Group unit Purolator Courier Corp executives agreed to end dlr pact to buy Purolator allowing Emery Air Freight Corp to proceed dlr bid world s largest ground carrier response Emery renew request merger Basking Ridge N J based courier service NEW YORK ITT Corp authorized repurchase million shares common preferred stock as part program to enhance earnings shareholder value ITT also redeem three series preferred stock PARIS Airbus Industrie European airplane manufacturer buy engines proposed A wide body jet joint venture linking General Electric Co SNECMA France move boost GE s aerospace division bad news International Aero Engine consortium IAE group selected to provide engines A December when earlier GE engine dropped use plane International Aero Engine includes world s other leading engine manufacturers Rolls Royce Pratt Whitney Japan s Aero Engines WASHINGTON Michael Davidoff head trader Ivan Boesky s Seemala Corp consented to Securities Exchange Commission penalities agreed to help continuing investigation insider trading SEC Davidoff recently pleaded guilty federal court to violating government s net capital requirements brokers traders NEW YORK Several major computer companies launched new computers Italy s Olivetti becoming first major firm to promise products to compete International Business Machines new personal reuters.unknown: A RM f reute r f AM budget

text.title: TEXAS MAY CONSIDER INCOME TAX TO SOLVE BUDGET WOES
text.author: By Peter Elsworth Reuters
text.body: The State Texas faced record billion dlr budget deficit over next two years may to consider introducing income tax economic analysts Such possibility unthinkable few years back when state s enormous wealth oil gas revenues easily allowed Texans luxury paying no personal or corporate income tax However year s dramatic slump oil prices only sent Texas economy into tailspin but cut heavily into state s tax revenues Both Moody s Investor Services Standard Poor s cut their credit ratings state to double top triple early March Moody s Vice President George W Leung first time Texas rating been lowered since adding report noted while the Legislature now considering proposals to restore budget balance medium term prospects full recovery weak only slight improvement economy seen by State Comptroller Bob Bullock Texas Legislature must grapple one billion dlr deficit by August another billion dlr deficit by end next biennium No other state U S history faced such deficit There strong independent streak Texans five years ago I never dreamed State Legislature institute income tax George Bland Assistant Professor Political Science at North Texas State University adding Now my contacts at Legislature tell me s coming s inevitable s only matter time State taxes on oil gas production traditionally supplied as much as third state s revenues However source fallen to pct recent years year s price slump state s dependence on sales taxes approaching pct Bland he believes Tax Reform Act be major factor state s decision because under sales taxes no longer deductible federal income tax while state income tax John Kennedy senior research associate at Austin based Texas Research League There great deal popular sentiment against plus first plank Governor Clements platform no tax increases let alone new tax However he since oil price fall state faced choice either instituting income tax or broadening possibly raising sales tax Steve Pejovich director Center Free Enterprise at Texas M University opponent income taxes he favored reforming present tax system to take account changed structure economy We should rely less on traditional sources such as oil agriculture real estate more on service industries manufacturing high tech Pejovich Tony Proffitt aide to State Comptroller Bob Bullock Bullock opposed to income tax but warned Legislature if they get tired looking at everything else s only option Apart Texas states no individual income tax Alaska Florida Nevada New Hampshire South Dakota Washington Wyoming time being Attorney General Jim Mattox ruled Legislature may carry over current one billion dlr deficit into next biennium even though state consitution requires balanced budget But as State Treasurer Ann Richards Thursday Jim Mattox s decision today turns heat down on pressure cooker but we must think goose isn t still cooking Opponents to new or higher taxes argue favor spending cuts But state already under pressure Federal District Court to clean up overcrowded prison system or face dlrs month fines U S Education Secretary William Bennett accused state among others lax education reform Earlier year both houses Legislature citing financial restraints as well as teacher morale passed bills abandoning plans to require teachers to take competency tests Bland he believes state set up commission next year to study alternative revenue sources income tax being instituted as early as January If political leaders educated the effects Tax Reform Act I think there be gradual drift toward income tax he

text.title: SENATE REPORT REAGAN PLANS EARLY SDI DEPLOYMENT
text.body: The Reagan administration secretly developing plans early deployment President Reagan s controversial Star Wars anti missile system according to Senate study Near term deployment absurd dangerous course America Sen Bennett Johnston statement issued report It force us to break bank throw out ABM treaty commit us to arms race space Reagan administration engaged internal debate over Strategic Defense Initiative SDI as land space based anti missile system called may decide later month to reinterpret Anti Ballistic Missile treaty to justify acceleration SDI research to include development space testing Johnston Louisiana fellow Democrat William Proxmire Wisconsin whose staff prepared report accused administration covertly seeking early deployment as political ploy to commit United States to strategic defenses even after Reagan leaves office This report exposes fact without presidential directive or congressional consent SDI program being changed to pursue near term deployment strategic defenses Proxmire chairman powerful Senate Appropriations Defense Subcommittee In other words they re covertly reorienting SDI program without congressional approval

text.body: Dutch Finance Minister Onno Ruding there growing feeling World Bank International Monetary Fund commercial banks debtor countries should take greater lead assembling new financing packages The IMF Bank may be less inclined to put together large packages like Mexico Ruding told reporters briefing on week s semi annual IMF World Bank talks Ruding who also chairman IMF s policy making Interim Committee he reflecting feeling within two institutions Asked whether his comments reflected feeling institutions were being unduly pressured by Reagan administration Ruding replied we should go direction politicisation two institutions Ruding no country large or small should push direction He he expected commercial bank lending to debtors to come some criticism slow pace lending recently Ruding also he did expect any major initiatives to develop larger commercial bank role debt strategy or any new proposals dealing debt crisis itself other remarks Ruding many countries supported General Capital Increase World Bank he expected Bank president Barber Conable also to express his support U S opposed to GCI at present Ruding Interim Committee Communique support use indicators to assist multilateral surveillance but stop short supporting U S proposals automatic consultations if indicators were sharply out line policy objectives Monetary sources say U S suggested establishing norms or automatic triggers consultations among industrial states if policies deviate plan Currently plan also support France Netherlands Italy while Britain Japan West Germany all opposed

reuters.unknown: RM f reute b f BC POEHL WARNS AGAINST F

text.title: POEHL WARNS AGAINST FURTHER DOLLAR FALL
text.body: Bundesbank President Karl Otto Poehl weaker dollar be risky further appreciation mark damage prospects sustained West German economic growth speech to Institute Contempory German Affairs here Poehl It be extremely risky policy to aim further substantial decline value dollar to correct trade deficit He United States could face vicious circle depreciation inflation more depreciation if took route Poehl noted West Germany already taken steps to meet U S Demands greater stimulation domestic economy accelerating tax cuts cutting interest rates tolerating above target money supply growth He he been happy to brought forward five billion marks tax cuts now planned January to beginning year but he government faced political constraints getting such measures through upper house West German parliament But there were also limits to impact West Germany could accept on exports rising mark he Poehl West Germany relied on exports one third gross national product so substantial erosion export markets could be offset by increasing demand at home A further appreciation mark could even be obstacle to further growth he Poehl Bundesbank tolerated rapid money supply growth year because country enjoyed low inflation because external factors including low oil prices favourable terms trade given some extra leeway But Poehl West Germany now faced difficult dilemma over monetary policy underlying rate inflation now two pct reported negative inflation rates year West Germany affected more than before by exchange rate developments For time being we to focus our policy more on external side we can live more expansionary money supply But we must be very careful he He he shared some U S Concern Japan s trade surpluses affected European countries as well as United States Poehl welcomed so called Louvre accord monetary officials major industrialized countries saying importance February agreement to stabilize exchange rates been underestimated All partners agreed dollar at right level further changes damage growth he This remarkable change attitude especially on part our American colleagues he But he there still danger correction dollar s value could overshoot

text.title: YUGOSLAV WORKERS MAY BE ANGERED BY LOST SUBSIDIES
text.body: Yugoslav government plans to stop subsidising loss making firms anger hundreds thousands workers Western diplomats law proposed by Prime Minister Branko Mikulic goes into effect on July aims to end long standing practice supporting unprofitable companies Under law wage cuts be imposed on losing enterprises while those failing to recover within six month grace period face liquidation diplomats Mikulic s attempt to create market economy inevitable but still come as shock to those accustomed to government subsidies It bitter pill to be swallowed but if overdose taken too abruptly may adverse effects on system Western diplomat He if law applied too strictly probably provoke new wave strikes unrest Yugoslavia swept by strikes month following introduction wage freeze law later amended to allow more flexibility some exemptions what some political analysts saw as retreat by Mikulic But inflation moving towards pct trade union leaders asked how much more deprivation workers can take union leaders workers thoughout country already receiving salaries below limits set under existing law while others received no wages at all year because their employers unable to pay them Workers also complain much their income taken local state federal taxes Many others losing their motivation to work confidence government as they feel their decision making powers being eroded trade union officials Meanwhile official Tanjug news agency reported paper cellulose factory at Ivangrad Montenegro republic closed yesterday workers were given temporary leave Tanjug plant been running at loss years been operation closure result economic necessity rather than bankruptcy

reuters.unknown: RM C f reute u f BC ASIAN EXPORTERS FEAR

text.title: ASIAN EXPORTERS FEAR DAMAGE FROM U S JAPAN RIFT
text.author: By William Kazer Reuters
text.body: Mounting trade friction between U S Japan raised fears among many Asia s exporting nations row could inflict far reaching economic damage businessmen officials They told correspondents Asian capitals U S Move against Japan might boost protectionist sentiment U S lead to curbs on American imports their products But some exporters while conflict hurt them long run short term Tokyo s loss might be their gain U S impose dlrs tariffs on imports Japanese electronics goods on April retaliation Japan s alleged failure to stick to pact to sell semiconductors on world markets at below cost Unofficial Japanese estimates put impact tariffs at billion dlrs spokesmen major electronics firms they virtually halt exports products hit by new taxes We wouldn t be able to do business spokesman leading Japanese electronics firm Matsushita Electric Industrial Co Ltd MC T If tariffs remain place any length time beyond few months mean complete erosion exports of goods subject to tariffs to U S Tom Murtha stock analyst at Tokyo office broker James Capel Co Taiwan businessmen officials also worried We aware seriousness U S Threat against Japan because serves as warning to us senior Taiwanese trade official who asked to be named Taiwan trade trade surplus billion dlrs year pct U S surplus helped swell Taiwan s foreign exchange reserves to billion dlrs among world s largest We must quickly open our markets remove trade barriers cut import tariffs to allow imports U S Products if we want to defuse problems possible U S Retaliation Paul Sheen chairman textile exporters Taiwan Safe Group senior official South Korea s trade promotion association trade dispute between U S Japan might also lead to pressure on South Korea whose chief exports similar to those Japan year South Korea trade surplus billion dlrs U S Up billion dlrs Malaysia trade officers businessmen tough curbs against Japan might allow hard hit producers semiconductors third countries to expand their sales to U S Hong Kong where newspapers alleged Japan been selling below cost semiconductors some electronics manufacturers share view But other businessmen such short term commercial advantage be outweighed by further U S Pressure to block imports That very short term view Lawrence Mills director general Federation Hong Kong Industry If whole purpose to prevent imports one day be extended to other sources Much more serious Hong Kong disadvantage action restraining trade he U S year Hong Kong s biggest export market accounting over pct domestically produced exports Australian government awaiting outcome trade talks between U S Japan interest concern Industry Minister John Button Canberra Friday This kind deterioration trade relations between two countries major trading partners ours very serious matter Button He Australia s concerns centred on coal beef Australia s two largest exports to Japan also significant U S Exports to country Meanwhile U S Japanese diplomatic manoeuvres to solve trade stand off continue Japan s ruling Liberal Democratic Party yesterday outlined package economic measures to boost Japanese economy measures proposed include large supplementary budget record public works spending first half financial year They also call stepped up spending as emergency measure to stimulate economy despite Prime Minister Yasuhiro Nakasone s avowed fiscal reform program Deputy U S Trade Representative Michael Smith Makoto Kuroda Japan s deputy minister International Trade Industry MITI due to meet Washington week effort to end dispute

text.title: INDONESIAN COMMODITY EXCHANGE MAY EXPAND
text.author: By Jeremy Clift Reuters
text.body: The Indonesian Commodity Exchange likely to start trading at least one new commodity possibly two during calendar exchange chairman Paian Nainggolan He told Reuters telephone interview trading palm oil sawn timber pepper or tobacco being considered Trading either crude palm oil CPO or refined palm oil may also be introduced But he question still being considered by Trade Minister Rachmat Saleh no decision on when to go ahead been made fledgling exchange currently trades coffee rubber physicals on open outcry system four days week Several factors make us move cautiously Nainggolan We want to move slowly safely so we do make mistake undermine confidence exchange Physical rubber trading launched coffee added January Rubber contracts traded FOB up to five months forward Robusta coffee grades four five traded prompt delivery up to five months forward exchange officials trade ministry exchange board considering introduction futures trading later rubber but one official feasibility study needed first No decisions likely until after Indonesia s elections on April traders Trade Minister Saleh on Monday Indonesia as world s second largest producer natural rubber should expand rubber marketing effort he hoped development exchange help Nainggolan exchange trying to boost overseas interest by building up contacts end users He teams already been to South Korea Taiwan to encourage direct use exchange while delegation also visit Europe Mexico some Latin American states to encourage participation Officials say infant exchange made good start although trading coffee been disappointing Transactions rubber between start trading April December totalled tonnes worth dlrs FOB plus rupiah rubber delivered locally latest exchange report Trading coffee calendar amounted to only tonnes lots valued at billion rupiah Total membership exchange now nine brokers traders

reuters.unknown: RM f reute u f BC SUMITOMO BANK AIMS AT

text.title: SUMITOMO BANK AIMS AT QUICK RECOVERY FROM MERGER
text.author: By Linda Sieg Reuters
text.body: Sumitomo Bank Ltd SUMI T certain to lose status as Japan s most profitable bank as result merger Heiwa Sogo Bank financial analysts Osaka based Sumitomo desposits around trillion yen merged Heiwa Sogo small struggling bank estimated billion dlrs unrecoverable loans October But despite link up Sumitomo President Koh Komatsu told Reuters he confident his bank can quickly regain position We ll be back position first place within three years Komatsu interview He while merger initially reduce Sumitomo s profitability efficiency vastly expand Sumitomo s branch network Tokyo metropolitan area where been relatively weak But financial analysts divided on whether how quickly gamble pay off Some Sumitomo may paid too much Heiwa Sogo view smaller bank s large debts Others argue merger more cost effective than creating comparable branch network scratch analysts agreed bank aggressive expanded overseas entered lucrative securities business geared up domestic competition but they questioned wisdom some those moves They ve made bold moves to put everything place Now s largely out their hands Kleinwort Benson Ltd financial analyst Simon Smithson Among Sumitomo s problems limits placed on move to enter U S Securities business by taking share American investment bank Goldman Sachs Co Sumitomo August agreed to pay dlrs pct limited partnership bank but time being at least Federal Reserve Board forbidden them to exchange personnel or increase business they do each other The tie up widely looked on as lame duck because Fed stricter than Sumitomo expected one analyst But Komatsu move pay off time U S Regulations change near future if so we can do various things We only to wait two or three years until st century Komatsu Komatsu also willing to be patient possible routes into securities business at home Article Securities Exchange Act Japan s version U S Glass Steagall Act separates commercial investment banking But walls between two crumbling Komatsu he hopes further deregulation create new opportunities We need to find new business chances Komatsu In some cases these be securities related some cases trust bank related s kind deregulation we want Until such changes occur Sumitomo focus on such domestic securities business as profitable government bond dealing strengthening relations Meiko Securities Co Ltd holds five pct share Komatsu He Sumitomo cautiously optimistic entering securities business here through Swiss universal bank subsidiary Banca del Gottardo Finance Ministry expected to grant licences to securities subsidiaries U S Commercial banks soon following similar decision subsidiaries European universal banks parent holds less than pct But Komatsu reluctant to push hard similar decision on Gottardo subsidiary We don t want to make waves We expect be allowed two or three years he Like other city banks Sumitomo also pushing to expand lending to individuals small medium businesses to replace disappearing demand big business he added analysts Sumitomo to devote lot time to digesting most recent initiatives including merger ailing Heiwa Sogo It s Sumitomo been bold strategies Kleinwort s Smithson After s question absorbing juggling around be next decade before we see if strategy right or wrong

reuters.unknown: RM f reute u f BC ECONOMIC SPOTLIGHT

text.title: ECONOMIC SPOTLIGHT EXCESS MONEY HURTS THAI BANKS
text.author: By Vithoon Amorn Reuters
text.body: Thailand s improving economy may helped trade finance position but also created major problems local banks Thai foreign bankers They dlr saving cheaper imported oil pct export growth year contributed to country s first current account surplus years But bright picture together government program to help farmers cope depressed commodity prices coincides sluggish investment by private sector still feeling lingering effects recession Thai banks growing surplus funds difficulties finding borrowers since third quarter Kunthon Narkprom head budget planning division Thai Farmers Bank Ltd estimated excess liquidity banks peaked month at billion baht three times what he considered normal Bank Thailand figures show total deposits grew pct to billion baht while lending rose only pct to billion lending deposit ratio measures bank loans as percentage deposits fell to pct month lowest since s after averaging pct Thai banks cut lending deposit rates record six times since January during time average minimum loan rate fell to pct gross one year fixed deposit rate to pct Five banks announced week they cut their maximum lending rates to small borrowers by one percentage point to pct Kunthon Thai Farmers estimated banks now combined billion baht unused overdraft line as many small medium size companies delay borrowing anticipation more cuts interest rates record liquidity seriously hurt profits banks been forced to invest idle funds low yield government securities Kunthon banks hold four to billion baht short term government bonds bought through Bank Thailand s bond repurchase facility double normal amount Thailand s local commercial banks registered one their worst years overall profits falling over pct after pct decline Kunthon profits should increase pct year as banks adjust to new interest rate structure Olarn Chaipravat senior executive vice president Siam Commercial Bank Ltd told reporters week liquidity problem stems partly fact most loan demands come businesses seeking funds small labour intensive projects He there few large capital intensive projects many borrowers go offshore to meet their requirements Somboon Chinsavananond Thai Farmers fund management executive liquidity been aggravated by central bank s policy fixing stable baht dollar exchange rate permits Thai companies to import dollar denominated funds minimal risk currency exchange losses He underlying bearishness towards U S Dollar encouraged foreign borrowers who hope to pay less on loan principal when their loans mature Thai bankers central bank governor Kamchorn Sathirakul month rejected request to increase pct withholding tax on interest on foreign loans measure they reduce foreign borrowings governor replied bankers should extend more loans to rural areas instead Bankers some Thai banks offered credit worthy clients loans at near money market rates seven to eight pct bid to compete foreign funds market analyst at Siam Commercial Bank bank lending at such rates amount to pct all loans extended by industry foreign banker who requested anonymity segmented market approach used by Thai banks setting different lending rates caused dislocation funds financial sector eroded bank profits prevented banks taking more logical move further cutting interest rates He liquidity problem gives Bank Thailand perfect opportunity to assert more control on Thai money market Bank Thailand taking a step right direction by planning to float three billion baht bonds to mop up part surplus he but he added bank been lax using bond repurchase window as tool to absorb or inject liquidity into market William Wu head Treasury Unit Chase Manhattan Bank N A money market lacks instruments to absorb liquidity avoid sharp interest rate fluctuations He liquidity fuelled stock market s strongest rally seven years Thailand should seize opportunity to develop corporate bond market

reuters.unknown: F f reute u f BC JAPANESE AUTOMAKERS T

text.title: JAPANESE AUTOMAKERS TURN TO FOUR WHEEL STEERING
text.author: By Jeff Stearns Reuters
text.body: Major Japanese automakers gearing up to equip sporty models four wheel steering feature could become standard on high grade cars future automotive industry sources Two companies ready to market such cars soon they Honda Motor Co Ltd sell Prelude four wheel steering Friday Mazda Motor Corp officials say model new steering be out by mid year Mazda aims to ship cars overseas before year end but decision depend on initial consumer reaction Nissan Motor Co Ltd offered less sophisticated four wheel steering system on Skyline since August Toyota Motor Corp exhibited developments field at recent motor show Mitsubishi Motors Corp use system near future Though major U S European automakers also researched tested four wheel system they say they waiting to see consumer response to Japanese cars further improvements safety costs Four wheel steering allows drivers to easily manoeuvre into parking spaces gives more control on sharp turns Mazda officials believe new steering improve safety At extremes four wheel steering gives driver more control one official On slippery surfaces or at high speeds system reduces unnecessary movement vehicle While acknowledging added vehicle stability Honda engineer This invention intended to improve safety but aimed at allowing everyone to drive easily Mazda s electronic steering system tells back wheels to turn opposite direction front wheels at slow speeds but same direction at high speeds Honda s system mechanical similar but direction rear wheels determined by angle front wheels Nissan s system rear wheels move only parallel to front Automakers say professional drivers who tested four wheel steering say greatly improves handling official one U S Vehicle manufacturer four wheel steering technical improvement but uncertain whether translate into higher sales or profits All automakers interested something new he If becomes predominant factor everyone want to follow official four wheel steering partly gimmick to sell cars It s benefit secondary nature compared devices fuel economy or emission control General Motors Corp developed four wheel steering system but unlikely to market within next five years Y Hojoh engineer Japan branch General Motors Overseas Corp GM must consider costs to consumer he added industry sources additional cost system Japan probably make little difference to consumer as be added to already high priced models

juice ketchup sauce peanuts prepared beef products miscellaneous beans To help calm heated trade relations U S Japan s top business group Keidanren urged government to remove residual import text.title: SOUTH KOREA MOVES TO SLOW GROWTH OF TRADE SURPLUS
text.author: By Moon Ihlwan Reuters
text.body: South Korea s trade surplus growing too fast government started taking steps to slow down Deputy Prime Minister Kim Mahn je He told press conference government planned to increase investment speed up opening local market to foreign imports gradually adjust currency to hold surplus at proper level But he government allow won to appreciate too much short period time South Korea been under pressure Washington to revalue won U S Wants South Korea to cut trade surplus U S rose to billion dlrs billion dlrs Kim who also economic planning minister prospects were bright South Korean economy but government try to hold current account surplus to around five billion dlrs year next five years Our government projections eight pct GNP growth five billion dlrs current account surplus pct growth exports all seemed to be reasonable early year But now surplus growing faster than we expected he Trade ministry officials South Korea s exports rose pct to billion dlrs first three months year while imports rose only pct to billion dlrs Kim swing South Korea s current account to surplus billion dlrs dlr deficit very significant surplus enabled country to reduce foreign debt year first time South Korea s foreign debt fell to billion dlrs billion still among largest Asia This huge amount our foreign debt been one major constraints on our development year major turning point Korean economy Kim Kim his government plannned to reduce ratio foreign debt to country s GNP to pct pct The government however does want to accelerate reducing debt by making excessive trade surplus he Kim sudden rise surplus cause inflation lead to trade friction Seoul s major trading partners particularly United States We need surplus because we to reduce our debt but we taking measures to hold size surplus at proper level Kim

text.title: SEOUL STOCK MARKET CONSOLIDATES ON STATE MEASURES
text.author: By Jo Yun jeung Reuters
text.body: The South Korean stock market seems to be consolidating following government measures to cool rapid rise year domestic foreign analysts composite index hit record early week nearly pct up New Year when stood at but plunged to close on April day after government intervened Under measures industrial firms bank loans worth billion won or more must either offer new shares or issue convertible bonds to repay loans Securities houses to sell shares they holding if volume exceeds pct their paid in capital ceiling investment trust firms fixed at pct South Korean firms traditionally preferred obtaining low interest bank loans current rate pct to issuing bonds at higher rate or floating share issues attendant dividend pressures launch expenses Seoul Stock Exchange listed stocks grew explosively first three months year building on already impressive pct gain Analysts now expect market to pause temporarily then resume upward movement despite indirect government regulation They continuous growth nation s gross national product GNP trade surplus improved exports good performances by industrial firms all fuelled boom trade surplus widened to dlrs March February while government economists expect GNP to grow nine pct year Analysts deep slump real estate market also increased liquidity stock market Many investors still confident market lose strength seems likely to pause while then rebound again Park Sin bom director Lucky Securities Co There more positive factors than negative market still buoyed by ample liquidity thanks to economy s strong performance stock market began to recover during Saturday s half day session index closing at active trading on Monday but closed lower on Tuesday at on turnover billion won I say market flat time being very prone to profit taking after sharp gains first three months various government measures foreign analyst But market head up again after rest because fundamentals expected to rise investors be as bullish as ever at slightest sign market recovery He added newly launched dlr Korea Europe Fund impact on South Korean stock market despite small volume compared trillion won listed capital on Seoul exchange Local dealers recommend blue chips financial shares as these stand to benefit most continuing trade friction between United States Japan rumoured restructuring local finance houses Dealers also cite shares domestically oriented firms less vulnerable to effects gradual appreciation won

reuters.unknown: RM f reute u f BC JAPANESE ECONOMIC PAC

text.title: JAPANESE ECONOMIC PACKAGE SEEN AS MAJOR CHANGE
text.author: By Rich Miller Reuters
text.body: The economic package unveiled yesterday by ruling Liberal Democratic Party LDP marks start major shift away policies past private economists government officials A big step forward been taken Industrial Bank Japan Ltd senior economist Susumu Taketomi package seen as response to mounting overseas pressure to boost sagging Japanese economy calls supplementary budget more than billion yen later year plus increased imports Although measures must still gain approval Finance Ministry economists government find too difficult to alter measures significantly once they gained domestic overseas backing At LDP Ministry Finance turning corner Sumitomo Bank Ltd s chief economist Masahiko Koido past five years government adhered to tight fiscal policy drive to stop issuing deficit financing bonds To meet goal spending departments required to submit annual budgets current expenditure pct below previous year investment five pct below Masayoshi Ito chairman LDP s policy affairs council yesterday government must stick to fiscal reform target but should review ceiling places on public works spending Even some Finance Ministry officials privately acknowledge policy changes might be needed including easing government s iron grip on spending Economists government could meet target also increase spending by using money got sale Nippon Telegraph Telephone Corp shares by taking advantage lower than expected interest rates on debt Officially Finance Ministry adhering to tight stance but some signs change appeared We do any intention abandoning our objective to restore fiscal balance Finance Ministry spokesman He so far ministry tried to achieve two goals simultaneously These were reforming government s fiscal position stimulating domestic demand But Finance Ministry spokesman added In looking at current situation economy relationship between Japan United States we feel we to place more emphasis on stimulating demand Economists predict battles within government over coming months as Finance Ministry fights to ensure cracks policy do lead to complete breakdown fiscal discipline The Ministry afraid once there small hole dike lead to flood Industrial Bank s Taketomi But Taketomi ministry provided device place to check excess spending political reasons likely to give go ahead to shift policy This seems to mark first step toward more active fiscal policy response to requests international community he Sumitomo s Koido if government quickly implements LDP s billion yen package economic growth year ending next March could be around three pct His current forecast pct growth assumes supplementary budget around billion yen

text.title: SOUTH KOREA STUDIES RESTRUCTURING FINANCIAL SECTOR
text.body: Deputy prime minister Kim Mahn je South Korea studying various measures to reform what he described as underdeveloped bank financial sector Kim who also economic planning minister told news conference country s banks finance houses developed to keep pace their industrial counterparts He two major factors hampered development financial sector high inflation heavy government intervention bank decision making He past government pressed banks to give soft loans to industry to boost economic growth Kim government now give top priority to interest rate liberalisation could be achieved within several years though within one year He liberalisation possible because South Korea s current account turned deficit to surplus brought foreign funds increased domestic savings current account recorded surplus billion dlrs after deficit dlrs But Kim government needed to reorganise much financial sector Kim mergers some financial companies upgrading others to merchant banks or full banks were being considered by financial development committee finance ministry He did elaborate but he expected no drastic measures to be announced year On liberalisation country s stock market Kim despite Seoul s determination to open up free investments there by foreigners be allowed near future because market currently over heated He due to ample liquidity created partly by country s current account surplus Kim market extremely vulnerable to sudden influx foreign funds because still very small terms size numbers shareholders Opening up capital market must wait until vulnerability to such influx removed he He only one South Koreans out population invest Seoul market

stable currency reflect massive inflow fresh funds two months largely Japanese U S Investors analysts polled by Reuters Fund managers want quality markets to park their cash settled on Australia Unit analysts We re looking more favoured market than perhaps U S Where some people be concerned value U S Dollar Lloyds Bank NZA Ltd chief economist Buttrose Why put money Australia where entry cheap currency looks stable But turning capital into more permanent productive investment depends on government economic policy he It only disappear if people lose confidence direction economy Buttrose adding offshore investors carefully watch government s promised tough economic statement on May While happy to invest bonds other vehicles yielding interest unobtainable elsewhere fund managers could just as easily reverse flow particularly Japanese who were badly hurt past by rapid falls Australian dollar hefty jumps bond rates analysts It remain very edgy money If something to be delivered if statement wasn t considered tough enough one might see substantial outflow Buttrose Offshore investors eager to see Australia take tough economic decisions to curb billion dlr foreign debt stubborn current account deficit analysts They giving us benefit doubt I think they like to leave money here Buttrose Reserve Bank policy also reflected increased interest investment Australia need to shield because crucial role Japanese investors Analysts they believed Reserve Bank worked successfully recent months to keep Australian dollar within range to yen Apart recovery against weak U S Dollar reuters.unknown: RM f reute r f BC ECONOMIC SPOTLIGHT

text.title: ECONOMIC SPOTLIGHT KUWAITI ECONOMY
text.author: By Rory Channing Reuters
text.body: Kuwait s oil reliant debt ridden economy started to pull out nosedive but oil prices determine pace recovery bankers economists say Crucial be ability member OPEC to hold oil prices around new benchmark dlrs barrel northern hemisphere summer when demand usually slackens Bankers estimate economy measured terms gross domestic product gdp shrank pct real terms year after contracting pct year before after taking into account inflation consumer prices pct slowing to pct Factors depressing economic activity include year old Iran Iraq war on Kuwait s doorstep threatens emirate s vital oil export lifeline through Gulf sapped business confidence But sentiment received much needed boost September when after series piecemeal steps to combat debt crisis caused by crash local stock market comprehensive new debt settlement program introduced share crash result speculative spree forward trading left billion dlrs post dated cheques default cheques were also used as collateral consumer spending thus generating informal credit system Much debt been watered down but big sums still owed by individuals companies There some billion dinars about billion dlrs outstanding bank credit at end one quarter to one third estimated by bankers to rank as bad or doubtful debt But government repeatedly allow any banks to go under new debt settlement scheme entails rescheduling problem credit over to years depending on whether debtors regular cash flows or Banks shareholders depositors their rights guaranteed by government edict vital significance country only people where financial sector biggest after oil Kuwait better placed than any other OPEC country to ride out oil glut bankers economists say Kuwait OPEC quota barrels per day bpd compared production capacity bpd mentioned year by Oil Minister Sheikh Ali al Khalifa al Sabah But strategic diversification into downstream operations Europe several years ago hefty refining investment at home gives guaranteed markets abroad enables to sell over one half output as high grade refined oil products Oil industry sources say Kuwait able to get average dlrs barrel more by selling oil form processed product such as gas oil kerosene naphtha rather than as crude Bankers say rebound oil prices major reason cautious optimism Other reasons low domestic inflation bottoming out fall imports recent years signs government spending on productive sectors remain steady External accounts good shape estimated billion dinar current account surplus pct below but still achievement recession hit Gulf Kuwait s petrodollar reserves mid were put officially at over billion dlrs earning investment income equivalent billion dlrs year But first time since end oil boom these reserves may be enough to prevent real budget deficit fiscal year ending June bankers say budget portrayed by bankers as mildly contractionary revenues were cut pct spending pct doubling nominal deficit to billion dinars left out income state reserves usually excluded official budget accounting forecast by bankers at up to billion dinars resulting some shortfall Bankers say too early to venture forecast economic growth year or next It depends on oil prices one This summer important Cabinet Affairs Minister Rashid al Rashid Sunday cabinet ratified recommendations to rationalise state spending favour productive sectors reactivate economy He gave no details but bankers say these expected to be spelled out budget possibly June

text.body: Norway June require finance institutions insurance companies to report lending volume to central bank once month rather than quarterly bid to tighten domestic lending Finance Ministry officials Norwegian Bank Association President Trond Reinertsen told Reuters new rule make more difficult banks to transfer funds to financial insurance companies lending Banks past used two month lapse loan registration to transfer money lending to finance insurance groups to avoid penalty reserve requirements lending excess government set ceilings new rule brings loan reporting requirements insurance finance companies line those already applied to commercial banks Ministry officials Borrowers increasingly sought loans finance insurance companies after central bank year clamped down on what called excessive bank lending Bank lending dropped by five billion crowns January billion crowns previous month response to stricter penalty reserve requirements Oslo bankers They recent central bank cuts overnight rate charges banks might offset new pressure on interest rates

growth He he been happy to brought forward five billion marks tax cuts now planned January to beginning year but he government faced political constraints getting such measures through upper house policy underlying rate inflation now two pct reported negative inflation rates year West Germany affected more than before by exchange rate developments For time being we to focus our policy more on external side we can live more expansionary money supply But we must be very careful he He he shared some U S Concern Japan s trade surpluses affected European countries as well as United States Poehl text.title: BRITAIN JAPAN CLASH OVER STOCK MARKET ACCESS
text.author: By Rich Miller Reuters
text.body: Britain Japan clashed today over U K Demands greater access to Tokyo Stock Exchange TSE as trade tensions between two countries mounted British consumer affairs minister Michael Howard told reporters he dissatisfied exchange s response to Britain s non negotiable timetable increased British membership warned possible reprisals future He described his meeting Tokyo stock exchange TSE head Michio Takeuchi he demanded greater exchange access as very frank indeed separate press conference TSE President Michio Takeuchi exchange done utmost to liberalise membership called on Britain to make some concessions According to Takeuchi Howard wants three British firms to be named members Tokyo stock exchange by end year Neither Takeuchi nor Howard name companies Next May earliest possible date opening our membership I want British government to understand Takeuchi Membership cannot be increased before space on trading floor expanded May he Howard told reporters good enough Britain use powers to ban Japanese financial institutions London if satisfied Tokyo Japan until next meeting senior officials two countries May or June to come up postive response to British timetable or face retaliation he The timetable constructed way made very reasonable request I expect to be met he Asked exchange s argument no floor space to expand membership Howard replied We find very difficult our country to understand why considerable ingenuity resourcefulness Japanese in world markets unable to overcome problems kind While here Howard he also expressed frustration huge trade imbalance Japan Tokyo s handling demands by Britain s Cable Wireless greater role Japan s telecommunications business According to Japanese newspaper reports at least some message may penetrated According to several reports Post Telecommunications Ministry considering Cable Wireless proposal telephone cable between Japan U S Ministry officials were unavailable comment

text.body: Bankers Trust New York Corp placed approximately dlrs medium long term loans to Brazil on non accrual status first quarter net income be reduced by seven dlrs as result Brazil suspended interest payments on billion dlrs medium long term debt on February U S banking regulations do require banks to stop accruing interest on loans until payments days overdue but Bankers Trust acted now because the high potential continued suspension result reaching day limit second quarter Assuming no cash payments at current interest rates received rest Bankers Trust estimated full year net income be reduced by dlrs Bankers Trust assumes debt negotiations between Brazil commercial bank lenders lead to resumption interest payments negotiations resume New York on Friday when central bank governor Francisco Gros expected to ask banks day rollover some billion dlrs term debt matures on April

text.title: STOLTENBERG SEES MOVES TO STRENGTHEN PARIS ACCORD
text.body: West German Finance Minister Gerhard Stoltenberg today s meetings major industrial countries look at ways strengthening Paris accord on stabilizing foreign exchange rates Stoltenberg told journalists he saw no fundamental weakness February agreement Group Five countries Canada to keep exchange rates near then current levels But he declined to say what measures be discussed ahead communique Group Seven ministers later today Stoltenberg Bundesbank President Karl Otto Poehl importance Paris agreement also known as Louvre accord been underestimated Stoltenberg there greater agreement now among major countries than six months ago at time annual meeting International Monetary Fund World Bank marked by sharp discord between United States major trading partners There no fundamental weakness Paris accord he We be looking at ways strengthening but I do want to discuss here Stoltenberg Louvre agreement working despite slight firming yen against dollar Poehl noted dollar mark parity unchanged since February without Bundesbank having to sell marks to support dollar The Louvre agreement been honored by market he Poehl West Germany lived up to side bargain Paris by preparing way tax cuts to be accelerated as way stimulating growth Poehl however Japan yet fulfilled pledges economic stimulation And we to see if United States able to do what they promised Paris on reducing budget deficit get through Congress he added Stoltenberg reiterated West German concern further fall dollar noting mark up pct against dollar nearly pct on trade weighted basis You cannot expect to go unnoticed economy just German problem European problem he
